page.title: 02 WHAT'S IN A NAME?
page.content: It is very often the case that place names reflect past history. Dalmilling district's name is derived from the French{"Dalmulin",}meaning{"the mill {in the field",}because from earliest times there was a mill,which is still in existence to_day, on the north bank of the River Ayr. In ancient times the parish was known as{Senechar _"Sean Chear",in Gaelic, meaning{"old fort".}Sanquhar,as it is now known may have been a fortress in Roman days. { Saint Quivox Parish}itself owes its name to{Saint Kevoc,}the patron saint of the church, which served the people of the parish, bounded south by the River Ayr and east, west and north by the parishes of Tarbolton, Monkton and Newton respectively.
